thread.title: Colts ask company not to fly Brady-bashing, Deflategate-themed blimp
thread.title_full: Colts ask company not to fly Brady-bashing, Deflategate-themed blimp

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Steven Gaither)
title: Colts ask company not to fly Brady-bashing, Deflategate-themed blimp
text:
Colts ask company not to fly Brady-bashing, Deflategate-themed blimp Sporting News 13 hrs ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Steven Gaither) © Charles Krupa/AP Photo Patriots quarterback Tom Brady takes the field to warm up before a Sept. 27 game against the Jaguars. An attempt at mocking the Patriots may have been deflated by the Colts before it ever got off the ground.
AdChoices AirSign planned to fly a 150-foot blimp with #DeflateThisBrady on the side when the Patriots visit Lucas Oil Stadium on Oct. 18, but the Colts have asked them not to, according to WRTV in Indianapolis.
MORE: The definitive Deflategate timeline | Brady vs. Manning, in photos
AirSign brand ambassador Eddie Thompson said the team asked the company not to fly the blimp because they are hoping to get past the controversy surrounding last season’s AFC Championship Game, and they will comply.
"We at AirSign.com have always felt that aerial advertisement is a fun experience and it is used to bring a positive and as you saw, humorous angle to events or occasions," Thompson said in a release. "We want to continue to work alongside the Colts in future campaigns."
Go to MSN Home
